com.camerontec.catalys.server.adapter.emx.test

Class DemoProviderClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.catalys.server.adapter.emx.manager.EMXClient
      • com.camerontec.catalys.server.adapter.emx.test.DemoProviderClient

  • public class DemoProviderClient
extends EMXClient
    A demonstration Fund Provider client for the EMX Integrator, controlled by a GUI. The DemoProviderClient extends EMXClient in a way that is appropriate for a Fund Provider company.
    Author:
    Christopher J Burton, 17/Jan/2002.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class com.camerontec.catalys.server.adapter.emx.manager.EMXClient

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DemoProviderClient()
      We use the constructor to create the threads we need to handle the delayed sending of ECNI messages and immediate sending of all other messages.

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(String[] args)
                 throws InterruptedException
        Instantiate and run a ProviderClient.

        No arguments need be supplied, but the first argument may be the name of a Properties file containing the following parameters:

        • CompID: The EMX Participant ID that we are connecting as.
        • hostname: The EMX host system that we are connecting to.
        • hostport: The port on hostname that we are connecting to.
        • LogBaseDir: The base directory in which logs will be written.
        Parameters:
        args - command line args
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - TBD

      • getNewPersister

        protected IFIXSessionStatePersister getNewPersister()
        Define a FilePersister to preserve our sequence numbers. This operation needs to be performed in this callback method to ensure that a new persister is created whenever the EMXClient parent class starts a new connection attempt.
        Overrides:
        getNewPersister in class EMXClient
        Returns:
        a new persister

      • start

        public void start()
        Start this DemoProviderClient.

      • setPricedTransactionResponseDelay

        public void setPricedTransactionResponseDelay(long delay)
        Allow the delay to be used for the ECNI thread to be specified.
        Parameters:
        delay - the delay to use

      • sendQueuedMessages

        public void sendQueuedMessages()
        Provide a method that causes any queued messages to be sent immediately. This method will not return until the queues have been emptied.

      • addEMXMessageToSend

        protected void addEMXMessageToSend(EMXMessage message)
                            throws Exception
        Replace the EMXClient's sendEMXMessage method with a method that queues messages for sending and delivers them to the parent EMXClient from an independent thread. In this way we isolate the desire to send a message from the requirement to handle any errors that may occur during the sending of the message.
        Parameters:
        message - a message to send
        Throws:
        Exception - TBD

      • handleOINPMessage

        protected void handleOINPMessage(OINPMessage oinp)
                          throws Exception
        Handle a OINP message. A real Fund Provider client application would implement this method to process an incoming order. We generate an appropriate TBKD and return it immediately, then follow it shortly afterwards with a ECNI. This is not what a real application would do, but it is close enough to suffice for a test and demonstration program.
        Overrides:
        handleOINPMessage in class EMXClient
        Parameters:
        oinp - The received OINPMessage that the application must process.
        Throws:
        Exception - If the message cannot be processed. The FIX engine will return the message again after reconnecting.

      • handleVREQMessage

        protected void handleVREQMessage(VREQMessage vreq)
                          throws Exception
        Handle a VREQ message. A real Fund Provider client application would implement this method to process an incoming valuation request. All we do here is to generate and return a minimal valuation response.
        Overrides:
        handleVREQMessage in class EMXClient
        Parameters:
        vreq - The received VREQMessage that the application must process.
        Throws:
        Exception - If the message cannot be processed. The FIX engine will return the message again after reconnecting.

      • handleTREQMessage

        protected void handleTREQMessage(TREQMessage treq)
                          throws Exception
        Handle a TREQ message. A real Fund Provider client application would implement this method to process an incoming valuation request. All we do here is to generate and return a minimal valuation response.
        Overrides:
        handleTREQMessage in class EMXClient
        Parameters:
        treq - The received TREQMessage that the application must process.
        Throws:

      • handleCSMHMessage

        protected void handleCSMHMessage(CSMHMessage message)
                          throws Exception
        Handle a CSMH message. We will create a new CashSettlementProcess indexed by the Transaction ID.
        Overrides:
        handleCSMHMessage in class EMXClient
        Parameters:
        message - The received CSMHMessage that the application must process.
        Throws:
        Exception - If the message cannot be processed. The FIX engine will return the message again after reconnecting.

      • handleCSMDMessage

        protected void handleCSMDMessage(CSMDMessage message)
                          throws Exception
        Handle a CSMD message. If there is no CashSettlementProcess for this Transaction ID, we will return a MERR. Otherwise we will increase the count of the number of CSMD messages received. If we have received the number stated in the CSMH message, we check that the total amount matches and if all is well we return a CSMA.
        Overrides:
        handleCSMDMessage in class EMXClient
        Parameters:
        message - The received CSMDMessage that the application must process.
        Throws:
        Exception - If the message cannot be processed. The FIX engine will return the message again after reconnecting.

      • logReceivedEMXMessage

        protected void logReceivedEMXMessage(EMXMessage message)
        Log all EMX messages that we receive by adding them to our lister.
        Overrides:
        logReceivedEMXMessage in class EMXClient
        Parameters:
        message - The received EMX message that the application can log in any desired way.

        Overrides:

      • updateConversationID

        protected void updateConversationID(int ackType,
                                    int msgType,
                                    String msgRef,
                                    long convID)
        Update the details of an already sent EMX message with the EMX Conversation ID assigned to it by the Hub.
        Overrides:
        updateConversationID in class EMXClient
        Parameters:
        ackType - Either MsgTypeMACK or MsgTypeMERR, indicating whether a positive or a negative acknowledgement was received from the Hub.
        msgType - An indicator of the type of the message that the MACK or MERR was in response to. In normal use of this method, this will typically be either MsgTypeOINP or MsgTypeVREQ and can be used to determine whether the msgRef parameter is an Order Reference or a Valuation Reference.
        msgRef - The Original Message Reference returned by the MACK or MERR. This will be the Order Reference or the Valuation Reference of the message your application originally sent. You can look up this message in your application's database (for example) by using this as the key.
        convID - The EMX Conversation ID that the Hub has allocated to the message your application originally sent.

      • handleCertificateNotFound

        protected boolean handleCertificateNotFound(EMXMessage message,
                                            String signerCompID,
                                            String issuerDN,
                                            BigInteger serialNumber)
        Handle the circumstance of not having a certificate that can be used to verify an incoming message.
        Overrides:
        handleCertificateNotFound in class EMXClient
        Parameters:
        message - an incoming message
        signerCompID - signer compID
        issuerDN - issuer DN
        serialNumber - serial number
        Returns:
        false, unless overridden by an application subclass.
